item.title: Trump’s Iran Oil Comments Strain His ‘Maximum Pressure’ Policy
item.description: President Donald Trump indicated that he might be preparing to ease his “maximum pressure” campaign against Iran, potentially undercutting a central policy dating to his first term and provoking consternation among foreign policy hawks who argue that now is the time to escalate — not lessen — pressure on Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Chua

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, during a news conference at the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) summit in The Hague, Netherlands, on Wednesday, June 25, 2025.

item.title: Starmer Eases Welfare Cuts in Blow to Budget and His Authority
item.description: Keir Starmer agreed to pare back a divisive £5 billion ($6.9 billion) cut to welfare to quiet a rebellion by his own party, a decision that will likely leave both Britain’s fiscal plans and the prime minister’s own leadership in need of repair.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham, Ailbhe Rea, Joe Mayes

media:content.media:description: Keir Starmer attends the British Chambers of Commerce conference in London on Thursday.

item.title: How the Senate Parliamentarian Tripped Up Trump’s Tax Bill
item.description: For Republicans racing to pass President Donald Trump’s mega-bill, the devil is in the procedural details.
item.dc:creator: Maeve Sheehey, Lillianna Byington

media:content.media:description: The doors to the Senate Parliamentarian's office at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, June 23, 2025. President Donald Trump's tax-and-spending agenda is nearing a climactic vote in the Senate this week in the wake of air strikes on Iran, which risk embroiling the US in a prolonged Middle East conflict. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg

item.title: US, China Have Finalized Tariff Understanding, Lutnick Says
item.description: The US and China have finalized a trade understanding reached last month in Geneva, US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Kailey Leinz, Joe Mathieu

media:content.media:description: A container ship sails out of the Yangshan Deepwater Port in Shanghai.

item.title: Carney’s Bill to Fast-Track Major Projects Set to Become Law
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s bill to speed up the construction of major projects such as pipelines, mines and electricity systems has passed Canada’s Senate and will soon become law.
item.dc:creator: Laura Dhillon Kane

media:content.media:description: Oil storage containers and pipelines at a terminal in Hardisty, Alberta.

item.title: Kosovo Court Orders Parliament to End Deadlock Within 30 Days
item.description: Kosovo’s top court ordered lawmakers to complete the inaugural session of parliament within 30 days, pressing politicians to resolve a stalemate which has prevented the formation of a new government since February’s election.
item.dc:creator: Gresa Kraja

media:content.media:description: Members of Kosovo's parliament in Pristina.

item.title: Treasury Deal Kills ‘Revenge Tax’ That Spooked Wall Street
item.description: The Treasury Department announced a deal with G-7 allies that will exclude US companies from some taxes imposed by other countries in exchange for removing the Section 899 “revenge tax” proposal from President Donald Trump’s tax bill.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Flatley, Lauren Vella

media:content.media:description: The US Treasury building in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, Aug. 29, 2024. The Treasury Department finalized rules Wednesday on reporting requirements for certain real estate transactions in an effort to crack down on money laundering in the US residential real estate sector.

item.title: Miami Defies DeSantis by Delaying Mayoral Election Until 2026
item.description: Miami’s city commission voted to postpone municipal elections set for November, giving the mayor and two commissioners another year in office in defiance of Governor Ron DeSantis.
item.dc:creator: Anna J Kaiser

media:content.media:description: Francis Suarez, mayor of Miami, speaks during at an event for Universa Investments in Miami, Florida, US, on Monday, Jan. 29, 2024.

item.title: EU Briefs Divided Leaders on Trump’s Counterproposal on Tariffs
item.description: European Union leaders are discussing their response to President Donald Trump’s latest proposal on trade after a briefing from Ursula von der Leyen.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: Newly manufactured Renault SA vehicles at the port of Marseille, France, on Tuesday, Feb. 18, 2025. US President Donald Trump said he would likely impose tariffs on automobile, semiconductor and pharmaceutical imports of around 25%, with an announcement coming as soon as April 2.

item.title: Trump Makes a Final Push to Get His Tax-Cut Bill Passed
item.description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the Republican drive to get their tax-cut bill passed. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
item.dc:creator: Joe Sobczyk

item.title: An Obscure Official Wields Huge Clout Over Trump Tax Bill
item.description: The centerpiece of Donald Trump’s legislative agenda just hit a roadblock in an obscure official who suddenly wields huge power: Senate Parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough.
item.dc:creator: Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: Elizabeth MacDonough Source: US Senate

item.title: NY House Member Says He’s Disgusted With Bessent’s SALT Offer
item.description: New York Republican Nick LaLota called Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s latest offer on the state and local tax deduction “insulting” and “disgusting,” raising serious questions about whether the GOP can strike a deal on the tax and spending bill.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: Representative Nick LaLota

item.title: Canada Steel Firms Say Tariff Response Risks Mass Layoffs
item.description: A group of Canadian steel producers said the government’s plan to restrict foreign steel imports isn’t strong enough and warned that the industry is set to shed thousands more jobs because of US tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Mathieu Dion

media:content.media:description: An employee passes in front of steel coils at a galvanizing mill in Hamilton, Ontario.

item.title: Pritzker Seeks Third Illinois Term With Eye on White House
item.description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker unveiled his bid for a third term with an attempt to position himself as a champion of voters’ economic concerns and a foil to President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Singh, Miranda Davis

media:content.media:description: Governor of Illinois JB Pritzker

item.title: Ackman Wants a New Rival to Take on ‘Superb’ Mamdani in NYC
item.description: Bill Ackman issued a call to his 1.8 million followers on social media to ask for suggestions on the “best centrist” candidate to take on Zohran Mamdani in the race for New York City’s mayor this November.
item.dc:creator: Nacha Cattan

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani, New York City mayoral candidate, during a news conference at Astoria Park during the New York City mayoral Democratic primary in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Tuesday, June 24, 2025. New Yorkers are heading to the polls Tuesday to choose a Democratic candidate for mayor as a sweltering heat wave engulfs the city, and with tightened security in place after the US unleashed airstrikes on Iran.

item.title: Hegseth Berates Media as Questions Linger Over Iran Strike
item.description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth used a press briefing Thursday to berate the media over reports that questioned the effectiveness of strikes on Iran’s nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: Ramsey Al-Rikabi

media:content.media:description: Pete Hegseth during a news conference at the Pentagon on June 26. Photographer: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images

item.title: Andrew Cuomo Faces Friday Deadline to Exit NYC Mayor’s Race
item.description: Donors and advisers mounting a campaign to convince Andrew Cuomo to drop out of the New York City mayor’s race are facing an imminent deadline to get his name off the ballot.
item.dc:creator: Laura Nahmias

media:content.media:description: Workers dismantle the stage following New York City mayoral candidate Andrew Cuomo's election-night watch party in New York, on June 24,

item.title: Carolyn McCarthy, NY’s ‘Gun Lady’ in Congress, Dies at 81
item.description: Carolyn McCarthy, the New York congresswoman motivated to enter politics by the shooting of her husband and son, only to find gun control a difficult sell in Washington, has died. She was 81.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Arnold

media:content.media:description: Carolyn McCarthy Photographer: Julia Schmalz/Bloomberg

item.title: Justice Department Investigates Hiring by University of California
item.description: The US Justice Department has begun an investigation into whether the schools in the 10-campus University of California system are violating federal law through discriminatory hiring practices.
item.dc:creator: Chris Strohm

media:content.media:description: Students pass through Sather Gate on the University of California, Berkeley campus in Berkeley, California, US, on Tuesday, Aug. 30, 2022. College students returning to campus this fall will find their dining halls experimenting with everything from fewer salad dressings to "plant-powered" Mondays as schools look for ways to adapt to soaring inflation.

item.title: Future of States’ AI Laws Hinges on Senate Rules for Tax Bill
item.description: Republicans’ latest attempt to use President Donald Trump’s massive tax package to ban US states from enforcing artificial intelligence regulations has hit a snag that endangers a provision favored by AI titans.
item.dc:creator: Emily Birnbaum, Oma Seddiq

media:content.media:description: Visitors near the painting "Declaration of Independence," left, and "Surrender of General Burgoyne," right, both by artist John Trumbull, in the Rotunda of the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, June 23, 2025. President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending agenda is nearing a climactic vote in the Senate this week in the wake of air strikes on Iran, which risk embroiling the US in a prolonged Middle East conflict.

item.title: Mamdani Shock Gives NYC Mayor Adams a Shot at a Comeback
item.description: Andrew Cuomo’s loss is Eric Adams’ gain.
item.dc:creator: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan, Gregory Korte

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani and Eric Adams

item.title: Trump Tax Bill Hits $250 Billion Health-Care Snag in Senate
item.description: A Republican plan to cut $250 billion in Medicaid and other health-care spending hit a procedural roadblock in the Senate Thursday, complicating efforts to pass President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Erik Wasson, Erin Durkin

media:content.media:description: Demonstrators during a markup of US President Donald Trump's tax package in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, May 13, 2025. House Republicans want to impose work requirements on some Medicaid recipients up to 64 years old and impose more costs on some beneficiaries to help pay for President Donald Trump's planned sweeping tax package.

item.title: India Trade Team Arrives in US for Talks as July Deadline Looms
item.description: An Indian negotiating team has arrived in the US, seeking to secure an interim trade deal before a July 9 deadline when higher US tariffs are set to kick in, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Srivastava

media:content.media:description: Operations at the Jawaharlal Nehru Port in Navi Mumbai, India.

item.title: NYC’s Bond Investors Calm Wall Street Anxiety Over Mamdani Rise
item.description: New York City mayoral hopeful Zohran Mamdani has rattled Wall Street with his plans to raise taxes on the rich, freeze rents and boost spending to pay for free childcare and education at the city’s public universities.
item.dc:creator: Martin Z Braun, Sri Taylor

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani, arrives for a campaign event in New York, US, on Monday, June 23, 2025.

item.title: Starmer Swings From Defiance to Deal-Making to Save Welfare Bill
item.description: Keir Starmer has pivoted to deal-making mode in a bid to stave off a damaging defeat on welfare cuts that are key to his chancellor’s efforts to balance the UK books.
item.dc:creator: Ailbhe Rea, Joe Mayes

media:content.media:description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Slovakia Vows to Veto Russia Sanctions Without Gas Guarantees
item.description: Slovakia is withholding support for the European Union’s latest raft of sanctions against Moscow unless its concerns about energy security are taken into account.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Hornak

media:content.media:description: Robert Fico, Slovakia's prime minister, speaks to members of the media in Rome, Italy, on Tuesday, June 3, 2025. Fico has emerged as one of the EU’s most vocal critics of sanctions against Russia, arguing they often harm Europe more.

item.title: Trump Decision on Next Fed Chair Not Imminent, White House Says
item.description: The White House said Donald Trump’s decision on a successor for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is not near, after the Wall Street Journal reported the president could make a pick as soon as the summer.
item.dc:creator: Kate Sullivan

media:content.media:description: The Marriner S. Eccles Federal Reserve building in Washington, DC.

item.title: Sheinbaum Disputes US Money Laundering Claims Against Mexican Banks
item.description: Mexico’s president responded defiantly to US measures that could cripple three prominent local banks on accusations of potential money laundering tied to drug trafficking, arguing she’s seen no evidence to support the crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vasquez

media:content.media:description: Mexico's president Claudia Sheinbaum during the Association of Banks of Mexico convention in Nuevo Vallarta, Mexico, on May 8.

item.title: Ramaphosa Fires Deputy Minister, Strains S. Africa Coalition
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa fired a deputy minister from the second-largest party in the ruling coalition on Thursday, a move that renews strain on the stability of his administration.
item.dc:creator: S'thembile Cele, Paul Vecchiatto

media:content.media:description: CAPE TOWN, SOUTH AFRICA - JULY 03: Andrew Whitfield during the swearing-in ceremony of the new national executive members at Cape Town International Convention Centre on July 03, 2024 in Cape Town, South Africa. The new National Executive constitutes the 7th Democratic Administration as a Government of National Unity comprising a diversity of political parties as an outcome of the national and provincial elections held on Wednesday, 29 May 2024. (Photo by Misha Jordaan/Gallo Images via Getty Images)

item.title: Abrego Garcia Remains in Jail Amid Dispute Over Release
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the Maryland man who the Trump administration mistakenly deported to a prison in El Salvador, remains in legal limbo after defeating a bid by the government to keep him locked up on criminal charges.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Hurtado

media:content.media:description: Katheryn Millwee holds a portrait of Kilmar Abrego Garcia outside the federal courthouse, Wednesday, June 25, 2025, in Nashville, Tenn. (AP Photo/George Walker IV)
